title: 3 Easy Ways to Reset a VIZIO TV With and Without a Remote

steps.title: Press the MENU button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the MENU button on your remote. You can also press the button with the cog. If your TV has a black screen or if you don't have a remote, see the power cycling section first.

steps.title: Select Admin & Privacy.
steps.content: Select Admin & Privacy . On some devices, you may need to select System or All Settings before seeing this option.

steps.title: Select Reset to Factory Settings.
steps.content: Select Reset to Factory Settings . Keep in mind that factory resetting your TV will erase all of your settings and preferences. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the PIN.
steps.content: Enter the PIN. If you don't see this requirement, skip to the next step. If you don't remember adding a pin, try the default PIN code: 0000.

steps.title: Select Reset, and then OK.
steps.content: Select Reset , and then OK . This will confirm the decision to reset your TV. Your TV will power off and turn back on automatically. It will be ready to set up again.

steps.title: Press the MENU button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the MENU button on your remote. This will open your TV's settings. If your TV has a black screen or if you don't have a remote, see the power cycling section first.

steps.title: Select Help.
steps.content: Select Help . On VIA Plus TVs, this may look like System . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Clear Memory and press OK.
steps.content: Select Clear Memory and press OK . This may also look like Reset and Admin .

steps.title: Select Reset TV to Factory Defaults and press OK.
steps.content: Select Reset TV to Factory Defaults and press OK . This may also look like Clear Memory/Factory Defaults .

steps.title: Enter the PIN and press OK.
steps.content: Enter the PIN and press OK . If you don't remember adding a pin, try the default PIN code: 0000. Your TV will power off and turn back on automatically. It will be ready to set up again.

steps.title: Turn off the TV.
steps.content: Turn off the TV. Use this method if your TV has a black screen or if you don't have the remote . If you have a remote and it isn't working, Cathey advises to make sure the batteries "have a good connection and that you don't see any corrosion or the little white powder." If you see this, you'll need to use a new set of batteries. Power cycling your TV can reset it and get it back on again. Once it's on, you can factory reset it using the methods above.

steps.title: Remove all connected cables.
steps.content: Remove all connected cables. This includes any HDMI cables, soundbars , streaming sticks , or Ethernet.

steps.title: Unplug the TV.
steps.content: Unplug the TV. If it's plugged into a power strip, unplug that as well.

steps.title: Hold down the TV's power button for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Hold down the TV's power button for 10 seconds. This button is either on the front corner of the TV or on the back. Holding it down can help drain any residual power.

steps.title: Wait at least 5 minutes.
steps.content: Wait at least 5 minutes. This will make sure all the power has drained out.

steps.title: Plug everything back in.
steps.content: Plug everything back in. Try turning the TV on again. If it works, you can now factory reset using the methods above. If it doesn't, repeat as needed.
